intro: Dicerandra frutescens var. modesta, commonly known as the modest dicerandra, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The plant is often found in sandy soils in open woodlands and along stream banks. It produces a distinctive, aromatic scent that attracts pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
